page.title: 12TEDSTILL COTTAGES
page.content:
{Tedstill cottages}are three kilometres south of Bridgnorth in the countryside.They were built in{1805.
There used to be four houses but now there are only three.Both ends of the cottages have been modernized.The back of the homes used to each have a wash house, and each house also had its own {pigsty.}There used to be a{well}in the back yard which supplied them with water.For a{bath,}they used a tin bath in front of the fire.
At number three in the sitting room there used to be a pantry, and in the pantry was a salting slab where they salted the pigs to store the meat.
